data.title: Number of holes in string
data.statement:
<<Goal :>>
You are given [[N]] strings as input. Your goal is to find the number of holes in the letters of each string [[s]].

<<Rules :>>
Letters {{a}},{{b}},{{d}},{{e}},{{o}},{{p}},{{q}},{{A}},{{D}},{{O}},{{P}},{{Q}},{{R}} have one hole. Letters {{g}},{{B}} have two holes. All other letters have no holes.

<<Example :>>
The string "HelloWorld" has 4 holes in its letters : one in the {{e}}, one in each {{o}} and one in the {{d}}.

data.stubGenerator:
read n:int
loop n read s:string(51)
loop n write answer

STATEMENT
Find the number of holes in the letters of each string

INPUT
s: the string to explore

OUTPUT
nb_holes: The number of holes in the letters of the string s
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[N]] for the number of strings.
<<Next [[N]] lines:>> A string [[s]] to compute.
data.outputDescription: <<[[N]] lines:>> An integer [[nb_holes]] : The number of holes in the letters of the string [[s]].

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Goal :
You are given N strings as input. Your goal is to find the number of holes in the letters of each string s.

Rules :
Letters a,b,d,e,o,p,q,A,D,O,P,Q,R have one hole. Letters g,B have two holes. All other letters have no holes.

Example :
The string "HelloWorld" has 4 holes in its letters : one in the e, one in each o and one in the d.
Input
Line 1: An integer N for the number of strings.
Next N lines: A string s to compute.
Output
N lines: An integer nb_holes : The number of holes in the letters of the string s.
Constraints
0 < N < 100
0 < length(s) < 50
s contains only letters
Example
Input
1
o
Output
1
